meanings.definition: In a way that shows the difference between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: She explained the concept contrastively, making it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: He compared the two paintings contrastively to see their differences.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog contrastively decided to share the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang contrastively in the quiet library, drawing attention.
meanings.sent5: The bright red apple stood out contrastively among the green ones.

meanings.definition: In a manner that highlights the distinction between two or more elements.
meanings.sent1: The teacher contrastively explained the new grammar rule to the students.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted the sky and sea contrastively to emphasize their separation.
meanings.sent3: The siblings contrastively chose different flavors of ice cream at the shop.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed contrastively in the empty hallway, creating an eerie effect.
meanings.sent5: The bold font stood out contrastively on the poster, grabbing attention.
